intro: Dipteracanthus menthoides, commonly known as the Menthol-like Dicot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, menthol-scented leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
